translation: And seeing all this scene, the heart of the demon-king was filled with fear.14.
The horses are neighing and the elephants are roaring;

gurmukhi: Bt bwNh ktI jnu ieMdR DujM ]
translation: The chopped long arms of the warriors look like the flag of Indra;
The warriors are writhing and the elephants are roaring in such a way,

gurmukhi: suix kY Duin swvx myG ljM ]15]
transliteration: Soun(i) Kai Dhoun(i) Saavan Megh Lajan||15||
translation: That the clouds of the month of Sawan are feeling shy.15.

gurmukhi: ibclXo pg d√çYk iPrXo pun jXoN ]
transliteration: Bichadyo Pag Dvaik Phiryo Poun Jyon||
translation: As soon as the horse of Hiranayakashipu turned a little, he himself deviated and retraced two steps;

gurmukhi: kr puMC lgy Aih kRu`Dq jXoN ]
transliteration: Kar Pounchh Lage Aih Kruddhat Jyon||
translation: But still he was infuriated in the manner of the snake who gets infuriated when its tail is crushed by a foot;

gurmukhi: rx rMg smY muK KO cmkXo ]
transliteration: Ran Ran Samai Moukh Yau Chamkyo||
translation: His face was shining in the battlefield,
Like the blossoming of the lotus on seeing the sun.16.

gurmukhi: rx rMg qurMgn AYs BXo ] isv DXwn CutXo bHmMf igirXo ]
transliteration: Ran Ran Turanad Ais Bhayo|| Siv Dhyaan Chhoutyo Brahmand Giriyo||
translation: The horses are moving in so much intoxication and creating noise that the attention of Shiva was dissolved, And it seemed that the universe had been displaced;

gurmukhi: sr sYl islw isq AYs bhy ] nB Aaur Drw doaU pUr rhy ]17]
transliteration: Sar Sail Silaa Sit Ais Bahe|| Nabh Aur Dharaa Dooo Poor Rahe||17||
translation: The arrows, daggers and stones were flying and filling both the earth and the sky.17.
